fields.name: overview
fields.text: This form is to solicit candidate projects for the $50M of Bridge Off-System (BOF) funding that was set aside under MPMS #102105 (Municipal Bridge Line Item). All DVRPC PA counties are eligible to apply.

fields.name: email
fields.label: Email Address
fields.validationWarning: Please enter a valid email address.

fields.name: title
fields.label: Proposed Project Title
fields.placeholder: Short title using primary facility/ies and purpose or application.

fields.name: brkey
fields.label: Bridge Key (5-6 digit number unique to the bridge)

fields.name: purpose
fields.label: Summarize Your Project's Purpose
fields.placeholder: What is the desired result from this project? For example, will it improve the condition of a bridge, achieve LOS D or better at the intersection, eliminate crashes, etc. Your statement should allow for a reasonable range of alternatives (e.g. rehab or replace bridge). In many cases, the purpose can be stated in a single sentence. If a project has several distinct purposes, each purpose should be individually listed. The purpose statement should not be a laundry list of all the potential benefits of building a project, nor should it list every possible purpose that could conceivably apply to the project.

fields.name: need
fields.label: Summarize Your Project's Need
fields.placeholder: Project What problem will your project address? For example, a poor condition bridge. The need should be factual, quantifiable, establish evidence of current or future transportation problems, and justify commitment of funding this project and impacts to the environment. E.g., If we don't address this bridge's poor condition, then XXX.

fields.name: cost
fields.label: Cost Estimates for Base Year of 2025

sections.title: Reference of Proposed Project in Planning Documents

fields.name: plans
fields.label: Is the proposed project referenced or supported in any existing planning document(s) from the list below?

fields.name: plan_name
fields.label: Please list the name of the plan and the year published for documents noted above.

fields.name: asset_impact
fields.label: Please choose one of the two statements below that best reflects your proposed asset improvement (bridge, road, transit, or other asset types):
options: The project will bring the asset from a poor condition into a good state of repair.
The project will extend the useful life of a facility/asset that is currently not in poor condition.

fields.name: safety_strats
fields.label: Will the project implement any of the following safety strategies? Select all that apply.
options: Sequential Dynamic Chevrons for horizontal curves
Speed safety cameras - Fixed and P2P
Install median cable barriers on rural four-lane (or more) freeways
Pavement friction management at ramps and horizontal curves
Medians and ped refuge islands in urban and suburban areas
Install a traffic signal or convert to all-way stop control
Advance yield or stop markings and signs
Systemic application of multiple low cost countermeasures at stop controlled intersections - rural locations
In-lane warning pavement markings for horizontal curves
Traffic Calming - vertical deflection strategies (including speed humps, raised pedestrian crosswalks, etc.)
Install a "Vehicles Entering When Flashing" system
Systemic application of multiple low cost countermeasures at stop controlled intersections - suburban and urban locations
Traffic calming (general, if specific details are not known)

fields.name: mobility
fields.label: Will your project impact existing traffic movements by involving any of these activities? Select all that apply
options: Adding an additional vehicular through travel lane
Removing an existing vehicular travel lane
Adding new traffic movement(s) at an interchange

fields.name: mobility_detail
fields.label: Please provide additional detail for your response in the question above. For example, if adding/removing a lane, please specify how many. Or, for a roadway extension, what road, how far, and what is the extent?

values: Adding an additional vehicular through travel lane
Removing an existing vehicular travel lane
Adding new traffic movement(s) at an interchange

fields.name: signal
fields.label: Will your project involve adding a traffic signal at a location that is currently not signalized?

fields.name: signal_detail
fields.label: Please identify the location where the new signal will be added.

fields.name: green_design
fields.label: Will the project include any of the following Green Design elements?
options: Vegetated medians/curb bump outs (more than just grass)
Other non-Green Stormwater Infrastructure solutions to address a documented flooding issue
Enhanced habitat connectivity or wildlife crossings

fields.name: attachment_desc
fields.text:
Please attach any appropriate support documentation, such as, but not limited to Resolutions of Support; approved documents from decision-making groups such as Executive Committees or Boards of Trustees; approved documents from other official decision-making bodies; etc. that will help support your project's inclusion into the TIP.

Please also attach any appropriate GIS files, maps, etc. that will help support your project's inclusion into the TIP.
